turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You care about him, don't you?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: We've got a good arrangement, that's all. Whistler makes the weapons, I use them, the vampires die -- end of story.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: My mother used to say that a cold heart is a dead heart.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Your mother sounds like a Hallmark greeting card.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Any progress?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Some. It's been slow --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You don't look so good.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm just tired, that's all. We've been up all night.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: For what it's worth, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You make it sound like I'm already dead.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I've been better --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: How long have we been driving?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I don't know. I woke up just before you did --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Is it bad?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: We get out of this alive, maybe I'll take that miracle cure of yours.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It won't work on you.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Get out of here --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm not leaving without you.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You don't understand. The Thirst --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: -- tearing me -- apart.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I know. Take some of my blood.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It's the only way. You know that. We'll never get out of here alive if you don't.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I can't -- I won't be able to stop --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Yes you will. The human side of you is stronger. I know it is.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I never imagined I'd be so happy to see the sun rise --  It's over, isn't it?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: For them. But for me --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: How's it going, Kam?

turns.speaker: KAM
turns.text: You're a week early.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I was in the neighborhood.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Whistler says I'm building up a resistance to it.

turns.speaker: KAM
turns.text: I was afraid that might happen.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Maybe it's time to start exploring other alternatives.

turns.speaker: KAM
turns.text: There's only one alternative to the serum.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: But you -- died --

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Deacon brought me back.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Fight him --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Please --

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Listen to your father, Jason. It's going to be a better world.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: How could you be a part of this?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: These are my people now. I'm one of them.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You don't have to be.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: You don't understand. I've killed, I've hunted, and I've enjoyed it.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I wish you could see the world as I do. Deacon opened my eyes. There's no turning back from that.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I don't believe that.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: You will. Time is on our side. Sooner or later, the Thirst always wins.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: This isn't human blood.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Then what is it?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I don't know --  Look at this blood smear --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: The red blood cells are biconvex, which is theoretically impossible. They're hypochromic, there's virtually no hemoglobin in them.  Look at the PMNs, they're binucleated, they should be mononucleated.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: What about the chemistry panel?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Curtis, it's three in the morning. I'm really not in the mood for one of your practical jokes.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: It's not a joke. I've got the stiff sitting in the morgue right now -- look, just come up and see him, okay? Five minutes, that's all I ask.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I thought you promised to give me some distance?

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: This is purely professional curiosity, Karen, I swear.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Five minutes, not a second more. And I don't want to hear a word about "us".

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You haven't started in on the internal organs?

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Just the blood sample from the pericardial sac.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: That's weird --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: He looks different now, burns are less extreme, some of these wounds have closed up --

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Tell me something, honestly, you ever have second thoughts about us?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Sometimes --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: -- but then I remember what an ass-hole you were and I'm snapped back to reality.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Jesus, Karen, you're breaking my heart here --

turns.speaker: DRAGONETTI
turns.text: Blade. Once again, our interests have fallen victim to his ridiculous crusade. He must be destroyed.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: You're wrong, Dragonetti.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: The Day Walker represents a unique opportunity. We'd be fools to waste it by killing him.

turns.speaker: DRAGONETTI
turns.text: Deacon Frost. You refuse to speak our language, you insult the House of Erebus by using the humans' gutter-tongue, have you no respect for tradition?

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Why should I respect something which has outlived its purpose?

turns.speaker: DRAGONETTI
turns.text: I see. And what would you have us do with this "half-breed"?

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Study him. Unlock the secrets of his DNA. He's the key we've been looking for.

turns.speaker: DRAGONETTI
turns.text: He is an abomination!

turns.speaker: DRAGONETTI
turns.text: The shadows suit us, Frost. We've existed this way for thousands of years. Who are you to challenge our ways?

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Someone who's sick of living off scraps. The coming age belongs to us, not the humans!  When the final war between our races comes, who do you want leading the charge?

turns.speaker: DRAGONETTI
turns.text: These archives are restricted to members of the House of Erebus.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Please. You and the other Elders wouldn't know what to do with these texts if your lives depended on it.  Which, of course, they do.

turns.speaker: DRAGONETTI
turns.text: You're wasting your time, Frost. Far greater scholars than you have tried to decipher these words. Whatever secrets they hold have been lost.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Perhaps.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: How do you like that? Right on time.

turns.speaker: DRAGONETTI
turns.text: The other elders will never let you get away with this!

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: How many of you are there?

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: A few thousand scattered about the globe. In the past, we've had to restrict our numbers for fear of discovery. That won't be necessary after tonight.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What happens then?

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: The Blood Tide. Our long-prophesied holy war against the humans. There's a force, you see -- a spirit that exists in our blood. I've discovered a way to invoke it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: LaMagra --

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: That's right. The answers were there all along, of course, scribbled down in the forgotten languages of my kind. Waiting for someone with the patience to decipher them. My elders were foolish enough to dismiss them as wives tales. But I knew better.  Imagine my surprise when Blade turned out to be the key which would set that force free.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: LaMagra isn't a physical being. He's a spirit, requiring a flesh and blood host in order to manifest himself.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Who better to usher in the Blood Tide?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: There's no need for any of this. Your condition can be treated. Whistler and I were working on a cure when --

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: What makes you think we want to be cured? Blood is only part of the equation. The hunt, the killing, that's what the Thirst is really about.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: But you use blood banks --

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Only as a last resort. Preserved blood is inferior. There's no flavor left to it, no life.  Fortunately, I've found a way around that particular obstacle.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You're a monster.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Why? Because we live at another species' expense? Your people farm cattle and veal, don't they? Fattening them up with steroids? It's called evolution, Doctor. Survival of the fittest.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Blade --

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: You're wasting your breath, woman. He can't hear you now. It's the Thirst, you see? It already has him in its grip.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: I was wrong about you, Blade. You were never one of us. You're a traitor to your race.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Get away from him!

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What -- ?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: You've been bitten by a vampire. We've got to try and burn out the venom, just like a rattlesnake bite --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Who are you people?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: My name is Abraham Whistler.  This is Blade. As for our little homunculus here --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: So what do you use, then? A stake?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Some of the old wives' tales are true -- they're severely allergic to silver, various types of wood. Feed them garlic and they'll go into anaphylactic shock --

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Consider it a parting gift. Vampire mace -- silver nitrate, essence of garlic.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: So that's it? You guys just patch me up and send me on my way?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: There is one other thing. I'd buy yourself a gun if I were you. If you start becoming sensitive to the daylight, if you start becoming thirsty regardless of much you've had to drink -- then I suggest you take that gun and use it on yourself. Better that, than the alternative.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: We keep in radio contact.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You've been listening in the whole time?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: You think I'd let him run loose without a chaperone? Blade ferrets their rat-holes out, I map them. Then we blow them all to kingdom come.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Whistler!

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Go on, I'll be fine!

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me the truth about him?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: We weren't sure we could trust you.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Blade's unique, you know. A one in a billion anomaly. He can withstand sunlight, garlic, even silver. But he still has the Thirst.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What happens if he doesn't take the serum?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: The Thirst overcomes him, just like the others. It's not something he can control.  The problem is, time's running out. His body's starting to reject the serum. And so far, all my efforts to find a cure have ended in failure --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No offense, Whistler, but you're not exactly working with state of the art equipment here. You might have missed something.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Which is why you're here. We could use someone with your experience.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Why do you hunt them?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Habit, mostly, just like this.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: I had a family once -- a wife, three daughters. Then a drifter named Deacon Frost came calling one evening --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He killed them?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Eventually. He toyed with them first. He made me choose, do you understand? Which order they would die in --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: How did you escape?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: I didn't. He was cruel enough to let me live.  Even gave me a souvenir to remember him by.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: And now you're using Blade to exact your revenge?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Frost's bodycount keeps rising, and I'm not getting any younger, am I?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: I wouldn't go in there if I were you. It's best to leave him alone when he's like this.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'll take my chances.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: All right, let's start with the basics -- why do vampires need to drink blood?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Their own blood can't sustain hemoglobin.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Then vampirism is a genetic defect, just like Hemolytic anemia?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Basically you'd have to re-write the victim's DNA, alter it so that the DNA will produce proteins capable of generating hemoglobin.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: With a retrovirus. It's injected into the bone marrow cells, it causes the host's DNA to mutate. They've been using them to treat Sickle-cell anemia.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: On me, yes. On Blade, I'm not so sure --  The problem is, Blade didn't contract the vampire virus from a bite like I did. He was born with it. The irony is, I could probably cure every vampire but him.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Then we're back to square one, aren't we? Sooner or later, the Thirst always wins.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What happened to the power?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: I don't know, but the back-up generator should've kicked in.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --and if she ever did--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --which she may have--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --or incredibly fucking naive.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Hey, folklore--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Why don't you just cut it down and count the goddamn rings--who <u>cares</u>?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Because it means the tree is older than the house.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: 'Give you a hand. I think my sleep for the night just ended.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Join the club.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: I need you to talk to me, talk to me about the dreams--about James, the other boys.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I don't...I don't understand them myself.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Try, please, Anna--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --bad boys, mean boys, <u>cowardly</u> boys--just like Domini.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: A coward too. That's why she had to go.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: What happened to her, where did she go?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Don't know--just that she was afraid--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --Anna--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: What, are you alright?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: My eye, is there something in my eye?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Not that I can see.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Closer. Lift the lid and look-- it hurts.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Closer.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: You killed Domini, didn't you, witch??

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'm not a witch, you're all crazy!

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --Jamie Kurth, Jonathan Edmunds--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --my God, Nick???

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Please! Please...? I haven't done anything.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Bullshit! Talk!

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Nick!!

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Domini?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What're you doing there?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Trying to find the energy.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Inside the grave?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: To stand up--I'm exhausted. Been on the road since yesterday.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Her father's Sheriff of Taos County.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Sometimes. Where are we going?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: --stop it! Stop talking about it! I'm gonna freak!

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I just wanna go <u>home</u>.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: Any number of reasons--pick one, it's as good as the other.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I was out hiking, camping the past two days--that's what did it--<u>I</u> killed it--

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: --doubtful, Mrs. Leavitt. The main thing to remember is, whatever the reason, it was for the best-- it meant something was wrong.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Something was wrong.

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: Look, this is not my field of expertise. You seem stabilized, but why take any chances? Let's keep you overnight and have the Staff obstetrician do a follow-up tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I guess--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: Mrs. Leavitt--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --I'm not staying here!

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: Let's talk to your husband--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --he's not my husband!

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Shit? This is from "Josh's Blair Witch Mix," man!

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Down or off--you're giving me a migraine.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Christ.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Just trying to set the mood for the mission--get the "feeling."

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Only thing I'm feeling is homicidal.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: The bitched-out babe in back here is one Anna Tassio--we met one dark and stormy night in a Blair Witch chat room, we all did--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --Christ almighty--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --but she was nicer then--sweeter-- she hadn't vomited twice already like today--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --it's called "morning sickness," asshole--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --a six week bun in the oven--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: 'Thought those all got stolen.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Guess they thought it was safe to put some up again.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Think again.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Why are we here?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: She e-mailed me yesterday this is where we should meet her.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: What's she look like?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No idea, just talked to her on the 'Net--she's very good.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --how old?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I dunno, probably right up there, based on her resume.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Then there she blows.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: "The Voiiiiices made him do it."

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: The Witch's voice.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Where they found the backpacks and all the film a year later.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Buried deep under 200 years worth of soil, ash, and compost layers.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Oak?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No. What's it doing here in the middle of the foundation?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Yeah, so?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: So whoever built this--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: This is funny?? This is tens of thousands of fucking dollars!  You pricks! I'll see you in fucking court!!

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Not the only things missing, Nick.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --nothing left to play 'em on, honey.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh, sorry, right.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: You can be goddamn sure, though, I'm going to be looking at every second of 'em when I get back to Baltimore--I get proof who stole my shit and I call the cops!

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: We're ticketed to fly back from Baltimore, anyway.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Druid Hill Park.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: That's a joke?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: That's its name. A pastoral glade gamboling with crackheads and homeless and averaging at least one homicide a week.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Looks like business is booming.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: There's some stuff that's hard to part with. Editing's stuff's up there--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --the witch kills children--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I haven't killed any--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Hang you like the witch you are, unless--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --Nick!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Cheery little place.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: It's like traveling back in time.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Whatzername--the "psychic" Anna hired.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Domini. Domini Von Teer.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So says her website.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: She <u>is</u>--she's helped solve a bunch of murders: Arizona, New Mexico--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's not whatzername--it's Mary Brown.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No, the kids were actors, the townspeople were real. Her, the Sheriff, the Convenience Store guy--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --whatever; that's her.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --<u>myth</u>--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --doesn't just pop out of thin air. It spins off of real events. At some point there <u>was</u> a Blair Witch--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --or one huge attack of group hysteria.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: <u>Yes</u>.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --chalked just hours ago by ancient adolescents. It's called vandalism.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What is <u>this</u>?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: That's a sapling--<u>this</u> mother's got to be three hundred years old, minimum.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It's a <u>sketch</u>, Anna--it's not to- scale cartography; the tree was not the kids' focus--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --do you <u>agree</u> it's that <u>old</u>, Nick?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Okay, fine, whatever, yes--it's an <u>old</u> tree.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --brother of Rustin Parr's maternal grandfather, somewhere after 1858--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --<u>whoever</u>--they built an entire house <u>around</u> a <u>tree</u>. Sticking up right through the living room. Somebody like to explain that to me?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: The rest of the family was crazy as Rusty Parr.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh, <u>c'mon</u>--even you have to admit this is weird.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No--<u>this</u> is weird.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Your parents didn't have a <u>bigger</u> one?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: It was <u>free</u>--I recall that was the chief selling point for you.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No offense, sweetheart: fuck you.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You know, Nick, you've been something of a total asshole the past few days.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Pardon me, I've had a few things on my mind--like putting this safari together.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Like how weirded-out you are with this pregnancy thing.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Let's just leave it at: it was one hell of a surprise.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You don't want it though.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Your body, your call.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Why is there no "our" here?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Could we take this up later--like indoors, without half the world listening?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You feel no need to get married or anything.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Anna--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --fine, later, fine.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You said the name "James."

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Baby names?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I don't know. Nightmare.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You want me to scooch over next to you?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes.
